reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I carry this thing EVERYWHERE.
reviews.reviewText: This tumbler has increased my water intake 100%. It holds ice so well, I fill it up with “nugget” ice at work before leaving at the end of the day. When I wake up the next morning, it still has over half the ice (11+ hours). The color is absolutely beautiful and screams aesthetic. I bought a little silicone boot for the bottom to prevent chipping the coating , I would recommend you do the same. It fits perfectly in my little car’s cup holders. The silicone straw was a must for me as, not sure about you guys, but I don’t look half the time when grabbing a cup for a drink and about knock my teeth out with normal straws. Also, the straw comes apart so it’s super easy to clean. The handle is comfortable to hold and feels sturdy. I’ve had this cup fall over a few times but the leakage is minimal. Of course with a tumbler straw, any liquid therein is gonna come out; simple physics.. the little airflow hole at the top also does leak if it falls over, but not a huge deal. I don’t have a Stanley, so can’t offer a comparison. Overall, this was definitely worth the purchase!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love it 🫶🏼
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had my hydro flask for about a month now and I can honestly say it’s one of the best tumblers I’ve had. I can leave this cup in my car overnight with ice and the next more the ice is STILL there! It’s keeps my drinks nice and cold and it fits perfectly in my car cup holders 💕 it’s cute, dependable, and stylish. What more can you ask for 🤷🏻‍♀️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect size for my water intake
reviews.reviewText: I like this cup as well as the popular Stanley brand. The straw is permanently placed in the center of the cover. The handle makes it easy to hold. The 30 ounce size is perfect for me. It is easy to clean and keeps my water cool.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable for small hands and helps you to stay hydrated
reviews.reviewText: I have small hands (seriously they haven't grown much since kindergarten and I'm 43 now). I thought this would be cumbersome to hold but it isn't. I find it very comfortable and not too heavy for my wrists. It is extremely easy to take apart and clean all pieces individually. I have washed it in the dishwasher multiple times and have not noticed any issues (still keeps water cold). The flexible silicone straw is very comfortable and makes it easy to drink out of (especially if the cup is on the counter and your hands are messy from cooking). I have only had water in this cup and the ice stays for a good amount of time (no, I haven't timed it). I was hesitant to purchase this based on size (40 oz) and have found that I am drinking more water due to its ease of use. That's a big win in my book. I will say that I have a tendency to fill cup a bit too full and it does have water come out of the top (from the base of the straw) but that is my fault for filling it too full. The other downside is that it gets a bit top heavy when the water is low. All in all, I use it everyday and am so happy with it. My husband even asked me to get him one (in a different color). He is very happy with his as well. We have never had a Stanley to compare this to but my parents do and they say the Hydroflask lid is easier to open.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this tumbler!
reviews.reviewText: I originally had a Stanley that I used every day and loved it.... until news broke that they contain lead. After doing some research, I found this Hydroflask tumbler. Hydroflask initially used the same lead sealing pellet that Stanley did, but changed their engineering process several years ago (2013-2015!) when it was first brought to their attention by consumers. I was impressed with Hydroflask's response to making a clean, toxic-free product and how well they respect their consumers. This mug also works better than my Stanley did... Stanley's leak when you tip them over, this does not. This fits well in cupholders and keeps drinks nice and cold for over 24 hours. This also is more aesthetically pleasing than a Stanley, the screws bolting the handle to the tumbler are covered and this makes it easier to clean. I'm really impressed with this mug and replaced my daughter's Stanley with this as well!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very good, not as cold as a Stanley
reviews.reviewText: I love the size, color, and feel of the handle. The top removes quite easily, much easier than unscrewing my Stanley cup. But, after two weeks I’m noticing that the ice melts much quicker so overnight my water is not very cold. This may not be an issue for some but I find myself replenishing ice more frequently than with my Stanley. As for leakage and spilling, I’ve purchased little stoppers you fit over the straws on Amazon and that solves the problem for any water bottle with a straw. It’s a nice product, love the flexible straw, a little less expensive than Stanley, but Stanley to me is top of the line.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I received this as a gift for Christmas.It is easy to hold. Fits in my car really well.It keeps my beverage decently cold for hours it depends on how much ice I add when I fill it.I add some ice and water to it before bed and the water is cold but no actual ice. I my heater is on so temp is about 70-72 in my bedroom at night.The straw is nice. I was told it was chewable but I don't usually chew on my straws so can't confirm or deny this.It does leak a little. There is a small air hold next to straw and if the cup is full or it falls with that small hole down it leaks. I haven't had the lid fall off at all which is nice. I could have made some big messes if that happened.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars beautiful cup & LEAD FREE too
reviews.reviewText: The Hydro Flask tumblers and bottles DO NOT have any lead used in their creation and will be my go to brand from now on. This cup is a beautiful two-tone color, fits perfectly in my cup holder, keeps my drinks cold overnight and its leakproof compared to its competitors. This cup is way better than your Stanley, if you're debating on buying this just do it. I threw away all my Stanley cups when I learned they are made with lead and can end up leaching into your beverages and I decided it just wasn't worth the risk. This is one of the very few brands that does not use lead to seal and insulate double walled stainless steel bottles.
it is just like the photo, ivory main body, oat accent colors! it is perfect conditions, it was unavalible on hydroflask webpage, but got it from here!

the colour in person is so cute! the only downside of this cup is that it doesn’t have the best straw… it’s almost too long? it pushes down at the bottom and makes it hard to drink fast without lifting the straw up. if your a 3am chugger i’d suggest an owala instead! but overall the hydroflask is a decent buy!

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen diseño, pésimo paquete, y cuidado
reviews.reviewText: Me dirijo a ustedes con gran decepción tras mi reciente compra. Lamentablemente, el producto que recibí llegó en condiciones inaceptables, mostrando daños notorios y golpes en la parte inferior. Esperaba un estándar de calidad y durabilidad mucho más alto de parte de una marca tan reconocida.Además, me gustaría resaltar que la espera de tres semanas para la entrega solo añadió a la frustración de recibir un producto defectuoso. Este tipo de experiencia socava la confianza en su marca y sus productos.Espero que puedan tomar medidas inmediatas para rectificar esta situación.
Es muy grande, mantiene las bebidas frías más de un día. Se me hace muy buena relación calidad precio:)

reviews.reviewTitle: Move over, Stanley - there's a new travel tumbler in town
reviews.reviewText: This was the coup of the year. Hydro Flask doesn't seem to have these available at any of their preferred distributors yet in Canada - you'd have to order them from the states, and that cost adds up fast.My partner is a huge fan of Hydro Flask and wanted one of these travel tumblers with handle and flexible straw that she'd seen online - but I was having zero luck. I found this by chance when looking for it at other retailers on Google Shopping, and grabbed it instantly. I'm glad I did.Build quality is fantastic. Heavy, thick stainless steel, tight tolerances on the lid fitting, and a good size handle that's comfortable to hold. This thing is rock-solid, and way bigger than I thought it would be (see cat for scale). The flexible straw is ingenious - there's a rigid plastic straw inside that connects into the flexible silicone upper straw, so you're not experiencing any problems with suction inside, but can bend the upper straw section to drink from any angle.Some reviews say you need to be careful of spills or leaking. This has not been our experience. My partner has dropped and knocked this thing over multiple times so far and it still looks brand new, and hasn't spilled a drop. Rock. Solid.The colour is a bit more blue than the pictures show, but it's really nice.Highly reccomend.
